description: Amount, before tax, of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) for unrealized gain (loss) from increase (decrease) in instrument-specific credit risk, realized upon derecognition of financial liability measured under fair value option.

tlabel: liability for unpaid claims, claims adjustment expense, claims paid
description: Amount, after effects of reinsurance, of payments to settle insured claims and pay costs incurred in the claims settlement process.

tlabel: debt securities, held-to-maturity, amortized cost, before allowance for credit loss, noncurrent
description: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of investment in debt security measured at amortized cost (held-to-maturity), classified as noncurrent.

This element represents the excess of the cost (face amount, notional amount) of an investment (security, contract) over its fair value which deficiency has not been recognized in earnings of the entity.

tlabel: gain (loss) on sale of trust assets to pay expenses
description: Gain (loss) related to the sale of trust assets (includes, but is not limited to, gold and silver) to pay trust expenses.
Investments held in physical commodities, such as gold, silver, platinum, crude oil, coal, sugar, rice, wheat.

tlabel: deferred tax expense from stock options exercised
description: Amount of deferred tax expense from write-off of the deferred tax asset related to deductible stock options at exercise.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), foreign currency transaction, translation reclassification adjustment from aoci, realized upon sale or liquidation, before tax
description: Amount before tax of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income for translation gain (loss) realized upon the sale or liquidation of an investment in a foreign entity and foreign currency hedges that are designated and qualified as hedging instruments for hedges of the foreign currency exposure of a net investment in a foreign operation.

Amount, before investment expense, of income earned from investments in securities and real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, real estate investment, policy loans, dividends, and interest. Excludes realized gain (loss) on investments.
Amount of payable for fee based on performance under arrangement to manage operations, including, but not limited to, investment.

tlabel: open option contracts written, at fair value
description: The fair value of the open option contracts written for the investment.
The fair value of line of credit assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

tlabel: other expense from real estate partnership operations
description: Amount of selling, general, and administrative expenses, and other expenses, related to investments in real estate partnerships.

tlabel: gain (loss) on sale of previously unissued stock by subsidiary or equity investee, nonoperating income
description: The profit or loss on sales of previously unissued stock by subsidiaries or equity investees made to investors outside the consolidated group that is not reported as operating income. Represents the difference in the parent company's carrying amount of the equity interest in the subsidiary or equity investee immediately before and after the transaction.

The current portion of aggregate prepayments received from customers for goods or services to be provided in the future, as well as the current portion of money or property received from customers that are to be returned upon satisfactory contract completion or as partial prepayment for goods or services to be provided in the future.

tlabel: mortgage-backed securities available-for-sale, fair value disclosure
description: Fair value of securitized, pay-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans classified as available-for-sale.

tlabel: mortgage-backed securities held-to-maturity, fair value disclosure
description: Fair value of securitized, pay-through debt securities collateralized by real estate mortgage loans classified as held-to-maturity.

tlabel: payments to acquire mortgage-backed securities (mbs) categorized as held-to-maturity
description: The cash outflow for the purchase of securities issued by a governmental agency or corporation (for example, GNMA or FHLMC) or by private issuers (for example, banks and mortgage banking enterprises) secured by and repaid from underlying mortgages, which were designated as held to maturity when acquired.
The net cash inflow or outflow associated with the aggregate amount of adjustment to the purchase price of a previous acquisition.

tlabel: liabilities of business transferred under contractual arrangement, current
description: The current carrying amount, due within one year or one operating cycle, if longer, of liabilities resulting from the transfer of a business segment under contractual arrangement where the transferor maintains certain risks, obligations or liabilities.

tlabel: proceeds from maturities, prepayments, calls of long-term investments
description: The cash inflow from maturities, prepayments, calls and collections of all investments, including securities and other assets, having ready marketability and intended by management to be liquidated, if necessary, beyond the current operating cycle.

tlabel: capital leases, lessor balance sheet, net investment in direct financing leases, current
description: The net amount due within one year of the balance sheet date or the normal operating cycle, if longer, consisting of: (a) minimum lease payments due on direct financing leases, (b) unguaranteed residual value, and (c) any unamortized initial direct costs, less: (i) executory costs, (ii) unearned income, and (iii) the accumulated allowance for uncollectible minimum lease payments.

tlabel: proceeds from sale, collection of lease receivables
description: The cash inflow associated with the sale or collection of receivables arising from the lease of real estate, equipment or other fixed assets for a specified time in exchange for payment, usually in the form of rent; excludes proceeds from sales-type lease transactions, which are classified as operating activities.

tlabel: contracts receivable, claims, uncertain amounts, expected to be collected in next 12 months
description: Amount of billed or unbilled claims or similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization under long-term contracts that are expected to be collected in the next fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

tlabel: gain (loss) on foreign currency fair value hedge derivatives
description: Amount of gain (loss) from the increase (decrease) in fair value of foreign currency derivatives and nonderivative instruments designated as fair value hedging instruments which were recognized in earnings, net of offsets by the gain (loss) on the hedged item to the extent that the fair value hedge was determined to be effective.

The current portion of aggregate prepayments received from customers for goods or services to be provided in the future, as well as the current portion of money or property received from customers that are to be returned upon satisfactory contract completion or as partial prepayment for goods or services to be provided in the future.

The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amount of (a) prepayments by customers for goods or services to be provided at a later date, (b) the amount of customer money held in customer accounts, including security deposits, collateral for a current or future transactions, initial payment of the cost of acquisition or for the right to enter into a contract or agreement, or (c) a combination of (a) and (b).

Expenses incurred related to the lease of aircraft from outside third parties that are used in the entity's business operations and direct costs incurred at airports primarily consisting of fees paid to the airport authority for takeoff and landing, gate and facility fees, and other related fees.

tlabel: debt securities, held-to-maturity, allowance for credit loss, excluding accrued interest, current
description: Amount, excluding accrued interest, of allowance for credit loss on investment in debt security measured at amortized cost (held-to-maturity), classified as current.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, current assets, receivables
description: Amount due from customers or clients for goods or services, including trade receivables, that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, and amounts due from others, including related parties expected to be converted to cash, sold or exchanged within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer, acquired at the acquisition date.

tlabel: foreign currency transaction gain (loss), unrealized, after tax
description: Amount, after tax, of unrealized gain (loss) from foreign currency transaction.

tlabel: security purchased under agreement to resell, subject to master netting arrangement, before offset
description: Amount, before effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes assets elected not to be offset. Excludes assets not subject to a master netting arrangement.

This element represents the excess of the cost (face amount, notional amount) of an investment (security, contract) over its fair value which deficiency has not been recognized in earnings of the entity.

tlabel: gain (loss) on sale of trust assets to pay expenses
description: Gain (loss) related to the sale of trust assets (includes, but is not limited to, gold and silver) to pay trust expenses.
Investments held in physical commodities, such as gold, silver, platinum, crude oil, coal, sugar, rice, wheat.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
Period expense related to postemployment benefits.

Liability for amount due employees, in addition to wages and any other money that employers owe employees, when their employment ends through a layoff or other termination. For example, a company may provide involuntarily terminated employees with a lump sum payment equal to one week's salary for every year of employment.
Amount of excess of rental payment required by lease over rental income recognized, classified as current.
Amount of excess of rental payment required by lease over rental income recognized, classified as noncurrent.
Amount of fee payable for management of operations based on performance under arrangement, including, but not limited to, investment.

Amount, before investment expense, of income earned from investments in securities and real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, real estate investment, policy loans, dividends, and interest. Excludes realized gain (loss) on investments.
Stated value of common units of ownership issued by a limited liability company (LLC).
Amount of receivable related to a loss contingency accrual that is expected to be collected within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. For example, an insurance recovery receivable.

tlabel: debt securities, held-to-maturity, allowance for credit loss, excluding accrued interest, current
description: Amount, excluding accrued interest, of allowance for credit loss on investment in debt security measured at amortized cost (held-to-maturity), classified as current.

tlabel: non investment assets less non investment liabilities
description: The net of non investment assets and liabilities. This amount represents the difference between the aggregate value of the investments, including long and short positions, and net assets.

tlabel: proceeds from sale of trust assets to pay expenses
description: Amount of cash inflows from the sale of trust assets to pay trust expenses.

Amount paid to managing member or general partner, affiliate of managing member or general partner, or affiliate of limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP) for administrative services provided to the LLC or LP, for example, but not limited to, salaries, rent, or overhead costs.

tlabel: other expense from real estate partnership operations
description: Amount of selling, general, and administrative expenses, and other expenses, related to investments in real estate partnerships.
Minimum amount of purchase arrangement in which the entity has agreed to expend funds to procure goods or services from a supplier.

tlabel: results of operations, accretion of asset retirement obligations
description: Accretion expense of asset retirement obligations related to oil and gas producing activities.
Amount of payable for common stock reacquired. Includes, but is not limited to, unit, membership interest, or other ownership interest.

tlabel: discontinued operation, provision for loss (gain) on disposal, before income tax
description: Amount before tax of (gain) loss recognized for the (reversal of write-down) write-down to fair value, less cost to sell, of a discontinued operation.

tlabel: interest income, operating, paid in kind
description: Amount of interest income from investment paid in kind, classified as operating.

tlabel: liability, other postretirement defined benefit plan
description: Amount of liability, recognized in statement of financial position, for defined benefit other postretirement plan. Excludes pension plan.

tlabel: difference between reported amount, reporting currency denominated amount, value
description: The amount of difference between the reported amount and the reporting currency-denominated amount. The default debit balance is based on the reported amount that is greater that the reporting currency-denominated amount.
Fair value amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the fair value method.

tlabel: life settlement contracts, fair value method, gain (loss)
description: This item represents the gains or losses recognized and realized during the period on investments in life settlement contracts sold during the period.

tlabel: life settlement contracts, fair value method, unrealized gain (loss)
description: The net change in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of investments in life settlement contracts held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.

tlabel: life settlement contracts, investment method, carrying amount
description: Carrying amount of life settlement contracts accounted for under the investment method.

tlabel: deferred tax assets, investment in subsidiaries
description: Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from the entity's investment in its wholly-owned subsidiaries.

tlabel: contracts receivable, claims, uncertain amounts, expected to be collected in next 12 months
description: Amount of billed or unbilled claims or similar items subject to uncertainty concerning their determination or ultimate realization under long-term contracts that are expected to be collected in the next fiscal year. Excludes interim and annual periods when interim periods are reported on a rolling approach, from latest balance sheet date.

tlabel: gain (loss) on foreign currency fair value hedge derivatives
description: Amount of gain (loss) from the increase (decrease) in fair value of foreign currency derivatives and nonderivative instruments designated as fair value hedging instruments which were recognized in earnings, net of offsets by the gain (loss) on the hedged item to the extent that the fair value hedge was determined to be effective.

tlabel: proceeds from sale, real estate, other, held-for-investment
description: The cash inflow associated with the sale of other real estate held for investment not otherwise defined in the taxonomy.
Amount of expense reduction under arrangement in which third party explicitly reduces its fee by specified amount for service provided in exchange for use of investment company's assets.
Amount of registration fee expense for issuance of shares or units.

Expenses incurred related to the lease of aircraft from outside third parties that are used in the entity's business operations and direct costs incurred at airports primarily consisting of fees paid to the airport authority for takeoff and landing, gate and facility fees, and other related fees.

tlabel: financial instruments subject to mandatory redemption, settlement terms, share value, amount, current
description: The amount that is required to be paid, determined under the conditions specified in the contract, if as of the reporting date, the holder of the share has exercised the right to or the shares are mandatorily redeemable within one year of the reporting date or operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: contract with customer, asset, increase (decrease) for contract acquired in business combination
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, from business combination.
Amount of transaction price allocated to performance obligation that has not been recognized as revenue.
The increase (decrease) in noncurrent deferred charges, classified as investing activities.

This element represents the excess of the cost (face amount, notional amount) of an investment (security, contract) over its fair value which deficiency has not been recognized in earnings of the entity.

tlabel: asset retirement obligation, revision of estimate
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in the asset retirement obligation from changes in the amount or timing of the estimated cash flows associated with the settlement of the obligation.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), unrealized gain (loss) on derivatives arising during period, before tax
description: Amount before tax of increase (decrease) in accumulated gain (loss) from derivative instruments designated and qualifying as the effective portion of cash flow hedges and an entity's share of an equity investee's increase (decrease) in deferred hedging gain (loss).

tlabel: public utilities, requested rate increase (decrease), amount
description: Amount of public utility's requested rate increase (decrease) with regulatory agency.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, assets
description: Amount of assets acquired at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, cash, equivalents
description: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, acquired at the acquisition date. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, current assets
description: Amount of assets that are expected to be realized or consumed within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer, acquired at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, current liabilities
description: Amount of liabilities due within one year or within the normal operating cycle, if longer, assumed at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, current liabilities, accounts payable
description: Amount of liabilities incurred for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business and related party payables, assumed at the acquisition date.

tlabel: public utilities, requested rate increase (decrease), amount
description: Amount of public utility's requested rate increase (decrease) with regulatory agency.

tlabel: capital leases, balance sheet, assets by major class, net
description: The total gross amount less the charge for the use of the long-lived depreciable assets subject to a lease meeting the criteria for capitalization.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, costs of goods sold
description: Amount of costs of goods sold attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, intangible assets, current
description: Amount classified as intangible assets, excluding goodwill, attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, intangible assets, noncurrent
description: Amount classified as intangible assets, excluding goodwill, attributable to disposal group held for sale or disposed of, expected to be disposed of beyond one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, operating expense
description: Amount of operating expense attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, revenue
description: Amount of revenue attributable to disposal group, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation.

tlabel: capital leases, balance sheet, assets by major class, net
description: The total gross amount less the charge for the use of the long-lived depreciable assets subject to a lease meeting the criteria for capitalization.

tlabel: consolidation, less than wholly owned subsidiary, parent ownership interest, changes, net
description: The increase (decrease) during the period impacting the parent's ownership interest in a subsidiary as it relates to the total (consolidated) equity attributable to the parent. The changes to the parent's ownership interest in a subsidiary represented by this element did not arise in a deconsolidation of the subsidiary from the consolidated financial statements.

The capitalized costs incurred during the period (excluded from amortization) in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. Exploration costs also include costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, the maintenance of land and lease records, dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions, costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells and costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.
Amount of gain (loss) recognized in settlement of litigation and insurance claims. Excludes claims within an insurance entity's normal claims settlement process.
Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of current portion of long-term loans payable to bank due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.
Amount of expenses related to the managing member or general partner for management of the day-to-day business functions of the limited liability company (LLC) or limited partnership (LP).
Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral properties, gross of adjustments.
Noninterest expense related to directors' fees which are fees paid by an Entity to its directors. Directors' fees may be paid in addition to salary and other benefits.

Including the current and noncurrent portions, aggregate carrying amount of all types of notes payable, as of the balance sheet date, with initial maturities beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

The total amount due within more than 12 month, or the operating cycle if longer, on all notes payable to banks paid on an installment. This can include the amount of any loans from the applicant firm. This does not, however, include any mortgage balances.
Amount of other miscellaneous assets.
Adjustment of the mine reclamation or mine shutdown liability account that is made when estimates of future costs are changed.

tlabel: results of operations, accretion of asset retirement obligations
description: Accretion expense of asset retirement obligations related to oil and gas producing activities.

tlabel: payments to acquire royalty interests in mining properties
description: The cash outflow from the purchase of royalty interests in mining properties is the amount of cash the mineral producer pays the owner of the mine or mineral resource.
Cash received from customers for deposits on goods or services during the period; excludes deposits with other institutions and time deposits, which pertain to financial services entities.

Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through registration of a trademark to gain or protect exclusive use of a business name, symbol or other device or style for a specified period of time.

Gross carrying amount before accumulated amortization as of the balance sheet date for the rights acquired through registration of a trademark to gain or protect exclusive use of a business name, symbol or other device or style for a specified period of time.
Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral properties, gross of adjustments.

tlabel: results of operations, accretion of asset retirement obligations
description: Accretion expense of asset retirement obligations related to oil and gas producing activities.
Amount of fees associated with providing collateral for the debt instrument.

tlabel: payments for purchase of other assets
description: Amount of cash paid to purchase other assets as part of operating activities.
Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral properties, gross of adjustments.
Cash received from customers for deposits on goods or services during the period; excludes deposits with other institutions and time deposits, which pertain to financial services entities.

tlabel: proceeds from sale of other assets
description: Amount of cash inflow from the sale of other assets as part of operating activities.

tlabel: research, development arrangement, contract to perform for others, compensation earned
description: The amount of compensation earned (contract income) under a research and development arrangement accounted for as a contract to perform research and development for others.

For an unclassified balance sheet, this element represents costs incurred by the lessor that are (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction. This amount is before considering accumulated amortization representing the periodic charge to earnings to recognize the deferred costs over the term of the related lease.

For an unclassified balance sheet, this element represents costs incurred by the lessor that are (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction. This amount is before considering accumulated amortization representing the periodic charge to earnings to recognize the deferred costs over the term of the related lease.

tlabel: other comprehensive (income) loss, reclassification adjustment from aoci for write-down of securities, tax
description: Amount of tax (expense) benefit of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income for unrealized loss realized upon the write-down of available-for-sale securities.

tlabel: other comprehensive (income) loss, reclassification adjustment from aoci for write-down of securities, net of tax
description: Amount after tax of reclassification adjustment from accumulated other comprehensive income for unrealized loss realized upon the write-down of available-for-sale securities.
The current portion of prepayments received from customers for goods or services to be provided in the future.
The premium (cost) of a hedge, expensed during the period.
Amount receivable from related parties classified as other.

This element represents the noncurrent portion of a long-term real estate loan to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.

tlabel: real estate assets held for development, sale
description: For banks, the total amount of real estate assets held for development and sale.

tlabel: related party transaction, due from (to) related party
description: Receivables to be collected from (obligations owed to) related parties, net as of the balance sheet date where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth.

tlabel: discontinued operation, amount of continuing cash flows after disposal
description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from (to) the discontinued operation after the disposal transaction.
Amount of long-term loans classified as other, payable within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: fdic indemnification asset, accretion of discount
description: Increases to the indemnification asset due to accretion of the loan discount relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).

tlabel: operating lease, residual value of leased asset
description: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee under operating lease. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

Amount of transfers into (out of) an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.
Carrying value of amounts transferred to third parties for security purposes that are expected to be returned or applied towards payment in the future.

tlabel: contract with customer, asset, before allowance for credit loss, noncurrent
description: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right is conditioned on something other than passage of time, classified as noncurrent.

tlabel: proceeds from short-term debt, maturing in three months or less
description: The cash inflow from a borrowing having initial term of repayment within three months.

Amount of foreign currency translation gain (loss) which increases (decreases) an asset representing future economic benefits from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.
Short-Term financing which is expected to be paid back relatively quickly, such as by a subsequent longer-term loan. Also called swing loan or bridge financing.
Fair value of the assets less the liabilities of a derivative or group of derivatives.
The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in receivables to be collected from the reporting entity's executives and owners.

tlabel: statutory accounting practices, statutory capital, surplus required
description: Amount of statutory capital required to be maintained as of the balance sheet date under prescribed or permitted statutory accounting practices.

tlabel: discontinued operation, amount of adjustment to prior period gain (loss) on disposal, before income tax
description: Amount before tax of an increase (decrease) to a gain (loss) previously reported in discontinued operations in a prior period.

tlabel: partners' capital account, public sale of units net of offering costs
description: Amount, after offering cost, from issuance of new unit of limited partnership interest in public offering.

tlabel: share-based payment arrangement, expense, after tax
description: Amount, after tax, of expense for award under share-based payment arrangement.
The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in retainage obligations due by the reporting entity that are payable within one year (or one business cycle).

This element represents the amortization of deferred leasing fees incurred by the lessor and amortized over the term of the lease. Such fees represent (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

This element represents costs incurred by the lessor that are (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction. The costs represented by this element are those costs not expected to be recognized in (amortized to) earnings within one year from the date of the statement of financial position or operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, foreign currency translation gains (losses)
description: Amount of foreign currency translation gain (loss) in the disposal group, including discontinued operation, recognized in the statement of income as a result of the sale or complete or substantially complete liquidation of an investment in a foreign entity.

tlabel: income (loss) from continuing operations before income taxes, foreign
description: The portion of earnings or loss from continuing operations before income taxes that is attributable to foreign operations, which is defined as Income or Loss generated from operations located outside the entity's country of domicile.

tlabel: asset retirement obligation, revision of estimate
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in the asset retirement obligation from changes in the amount or timing of the estimated cash flows associated with the settlement of the obligation.

tlabel: income tax (expense) benefit, continuing operations, government grants
description: Amount of tax (expense) benefit from continuing operations attributable to government grants to the extent recognized as a reduction of income tax expense.
Amount of expense for employee benefit and equity-based compensation.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants.

Total carrying amount of consideration received or receivable as of the balance sheet date on potential earnings that were not recognized as revenue or other forms of income in conformity with GAAP, and which are expected to be recognized as such within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of noncurrent interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.

tlabel: income (loss) from individually significant component disposed of or held-for-sale, excluding discontinued operations, attributable to noncontrolling interest, before income tax
description: Amount before tax of income (loss) from an individually significant component disposed of or held-for-sale attributable to noncontrolling interest. Excludes discontinued operations.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), foreign currency translation adjustment, tax, portion attributable to noncontrolling interest
description: Amount of tax expense (benefit), after reclassification adjustments of gain (loss) on foreign currency translation adjustments, foreign currency transactions designated and effective as economic hedges of a net investment in a foreign entity and intra-entity foreign currency transactions that are of a long-term-investment nature, attributable to noncontrolling interests.

tlabel: discontinued operation, tax effect of income (loss) from discontinued operation during phase-out period
description: Amount of tax expense (benefit) attributable to income (loss) from operations classified as a discontinued operation. Excludes tax expense (benefit) for gain (loss) on disposal and for provision for gain (loss) until disposal.

tlabel: financing receivable, troubled debt restructuring, increase (decrease) from modification
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in financing receivable modified from troubled debt restructuring.

tlabel: accumulated depreciation, depletion, amortization, sale or disposal of property, plant, equipment
description: Amount of decrease in accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization as a result of sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in earnest money deposits outstanding
description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amount of deposits given by the reporting entity to a seller which shows that the prospective buyer is serious about purchasing a property.

tlabel: net investment in lease, accrued interest, writeoff
description: Amount of writeoff of accrued interest on net investment in sales-type and direct financing leases recognized by reversing interest income.
Amount of long-term loans payable classified as other.

tlabel: proceeds from sale of other receivables
description: Amount of cash inflow from the sale of receivables classified as other.

tlabel: cash flow hedge derivative instrument liabilities at fair value
description: Fair value of all liability derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments.
Amount of other income tax expense (benefit).

tlabel: increase (decrease) in customer loyalty program liability
description: Increase (decrease) in the liability arising from revenue deferred or cost to provide future products or services resulting from customer loyalty program. Excludes liability associated with frequent flier programs. Includes liability associated with customer loyalty programs for other businesses, for example, but not limited to, hotels, supermarkets, credit card companies, automobile rental companies, and book sellers.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of leased physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

tlabel: partners' capital account, private placement of units
description: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a private placement.

This element represents the current portion of a long-term real estate loan to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.
Carrying amount due after one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants.
Fair value portion of probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.
Nominal or face amount on the investment owned.

tlabel: debtor reorganization items, gain (loss) on asset sales, net
description: Amount of gain (loss) on asset sales, reported as a reorganization item.

tlabel: interest expense, short-term debt, other, increase (decrease)
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in interest expense on short-term debt classified as other.
The portion of the noncash component of income tax expense for the period other than the portion from the net change in the entity's deferred tax assets and liabilities.

tlabel: trade receivables held-for-sale, reconciliation to cash flow, additions to held-for-sale
description: Amount of additions to trade receivables held-for-sale, after allowance for bad debt, that are not part of a disposal group.

The capitalized costs incurred (excluded from amortization), as of the date of the balance sheet, to purchase, lease or otherwise acquire an unproved property, including costs of lease bonuses and options to purchase or lease properties, the portion of costs applicable to minerals when land including mineral rights is purchased in fee, brokers' fees, recording fees, legal costs, and other costs incurred in acquiring properties.
Amount of accumulated undistributed tax basis earnings (deficit).

tlabel: unrealized gain on foreign currency derivatives, before tax
description: Amount of unrealized gain related to the increase in fair value of foreign currency exchange rate derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments. Recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income to the extent that the cash flow hedge is determined to be effective.
Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from inventory.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in outstanding checks, operating activities
description: The change in cash during the period due to the net increase or decrease in outstanding checks, the liability that represents checks that have been issued but that have not cleared. The entity may classify these cash flows as financing or operating activities. Another element, Increase (Decrease) in Outstanding Checks, Financing Activities, represents cash flows from outstanding checks classified as financing activities.

Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral rights, or rights to extract a mineral from the earth or to receive payment in the form of a royalty for the extraction of minerals, net of amortization.

tlabel: liability, defined benefit pension plan, current
description: Amount of liability, recognized in statement of financial position, for defined benefit pension plan, classified as current. Excludes other postretirement benefit plan.

Carrying amount (including both current and noncurrent portions of the accrual) as of the balance sheet date pertaining to a specified type of cost associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructuring pursuant to a duly authorized plan.

tlabel: due from other related parties, noncurrent
description: Amount receivable from related parties classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
Amount of funds committed to investment company from investors.
The contractual amount of dividends (or interest on participating income bonds) that must be paid for the current period (for example, unpaid cumulative dividends).

This element represents the noncurrent portion of a long-term real estate loan to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.

tlabel: real estate assets held for development, sale
description: For banks, the total amount of real estate assets held for development and sale.

Amount of transfers into (out of) an asset representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of value added taxes due either from customers arising from sales on credit terms, or as previously overpaid to tax authorities.

This element represents costs incurred by the lessor that are (a) costs to originate a lease incurred in transactions with independent third parties that (i) result directly from and are essential to acquire that lease and (ii) would not have been incurred had that leasing transaction not occurred and (b) certain costs directly related to specified activities performed by the lessor for that lease. Those activities are: evaluating the prospective lessee's financial condition; evaluating and recording guarantees, collateral, and other security arrangements; negotiating lease terms; preparing and processing lease documents; and closing the transaction. The costs represented by this element are those costs not expected to be recognized in (amortized to) earnings within one year from the date of the statement of financial position or operating cycle, if longer.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the liability arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to mitigate a specified risk (hedge), and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: income tax (expense) benefit, continuing operations, government grants
description: Amount of tax (expense) benefit from continuing operations attributable to government grants to the extent recognized as a reduction of income tax expense.

The portion of the carrying value of convertible subordinated debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer. This form of debt can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder, and places a lender in a lien position behind debt having a higher priority of repayment in liquidation of the entity's assets.
Amount of other research and development expense.

tlabel: partners' capital account, public sale of units net of offering costs
description: Amount, after offering cost, from issuance of new unit of limited partnership interest in public offering.

Total carrying amount of consideration received or receivable as of the balance sheet date on potential earnings that were not recognized as revenue or other forms of income in conformity with GAAP, and which are expected to be recognized as such within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

The amount paid to music publishers, record producers, songwriters, or other artists in advance of their earning royalties from record or music sales. Such an amount is based on contractual terms and is generally nonrefundable. This amount is expected to be consumed after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: unrealized loss on foreign currency derivatives, before tax
description: Amount of unrealized loss recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income pertaining to the decrease in fair value of foreign currency exchange rate derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments to the extent that a cash flow hedge is determined to be effective.
Represents total insurance tax expense reflected in the income statement for each period presented.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of noncurrent interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.

tlabel: proceeds from sale of other receivables
description: Amount of cash inflow from the sale of receivables classified as other.

tlabel: long-term federal home loan bank advances, current
description: The current portion of Federal Home Loan Bank borrowings initially due beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

tlabel: net investment in lease, accrued interest, writeoff
description: Amount of writeoff of accrued interest on net investment in sales-type and direct financing leases recognized by reversing interest income.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in outstanding checks, operating activities
description: The change in cash during the period due to the net increase or decrease in outstanding checks, the liability that represents checks that have been issued but that have not cleared. The entity may classify these cash flows as financing or operating activities. Another element, Increase (Decrease) in Outstanding Checks, Financing Activities, represents cash flows from outstanding checks classified as financing activities.

Carrying amount at the balance sheet date of mineral rights, or rights to extract a mineral from the earth or to receive payment in the form of a royalty for the extraction of minerals, net of amortization.

tlabel: asset, held-for-sale, not part of disposal group, other, current
description: Amount of other assets held-for-sale that are not part of a disposal group, expected to be sold within a year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: financing receivable, modified, increase (decrease) from modification
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in amortized cost of financing receivable modified for debtor experiencing financial difficulty.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of leased physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in due from other related parties, current
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in related party receivables classified as other, due within one year or operating cycle, if longer.
Fair value of the assets less the liabilities of a derivative or group of derivatives.

tlabel: share-based payment arrangement, expense, after tax
description: Amount, after tax, of expense for award under share-based payment arrangement.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in customer loyalty program liability
description: Increase (decrease) in the liability arising from revenue deferred or cost to provide future products or services resulting from customer loyalty program. Excludes liability associated with frequent flier programs. Includes liability associated with customer loyalty programs for other businesses, for example, but not limited to, hotels, supermarkets, credit card companies, automobile rental companies, and book sellers.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), foreign currency translation adjustment, tax, portion attributable to noncontrolling interest
description: Amount of tax expense (benefit), after reclassification adjustments of gain (loss) on foreign currency translation adjustments, foreign currency transactions designated and effective as economic hedges of a net investment in a foreign entity and intra-entity foreign currency transactions that are of a long-term-investment nature, attributable to noncontrolling interests.

tlabel: debt securities, held-to-maturity, transfer to trading, unrealized gain (loss)
description: Amount of unrealized gain (loss) recognized in earnings from transfer of investment in debt security measured at amortized cost (held-to-maturity) to investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in net income (trading). Includes other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) previously recognized in other comprehensive income (OCI).

tlabel: other cash equivalents, at carrying value
description: Amount of short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates, classified as other. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

tlabel: contract with customer, receivable, credit loss expense (reversal)
description: Amount of expense (reversal of expense) for expected credit loss on right to consideration in exchange for good or service transferred to customer when right to consideration is unconditional.

tlabel: accounts receivable, held-for-sale, not part of disposal group, reconciliation to cash flow, addition to held-for-sale
description: Amount of additions to trade receivables held-for-sale, after allowance for bad debt, that are not part of a disposal group.

tlabel: partners' capital account, private placement of units
description: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a private placement.

tlabel: long-term federal home loan bank advances, current
description: The current portion of Federal Home Loan Bank borrowings initially due beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle if longer.

tlabel: operating lease, residual value of leased asset
description: Amount of residual asset covered by residual value guarantee under operating lease. Excludes guarantee considered to be lease payments for lessor.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for rebates of an exchange fee some mutual funds impose on shareholders if they exchange (transfer) to another fund within the same fund group. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

Carrying amount (including both current and noncurrent portions of the accrual) as of the balance sheet date pertaining to a specified type of cost associated with exit from or disposal of business activities or restructuring pursuant to a duly authorized plan.
This element represents the aggregate cost of investments accounted for under the equity method of accounting.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for contractual rent under lease arrangements. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).
Amount of cash (inflow) outflow from deposits classified as other.
The contractual amount of dividends (or interest on participating income bonds) that must be paid for the current period (for example, unpaid cumulative dividends).

Amount of foreign currency translation gain (loss) which increases (decreases) an asset representing future economic benefits from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognized.

tlabel: other cash equivalents, at carrying value
description: Amount of short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates, classified as other. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

tlabel: deferred tax expense from stock options exercised
description: Amount of deferred tax expense from write-off of the deferred tax asset related to deductible stock options at exercise.

tlabel: discontinued operation, amount of adjustment to prior period gain (loss) on disposal, before income tax
description: Amount before tax of an increase (decrease) to a gain (loss) previously reported in discontinued operations in a prior period.

tlabel: proceeds from issuance of mandatory redeemable capital securities
description: The cash inflow from issuance of an equity security that embodies an unconditional obligation requiring the issuer to redeem the security by transferring the assets at a specified or determinable date (or dates) that is (or are) initially more than one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date, or upon an event that is certain to occur beyond one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer) from the issuance date.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in due from officers, stockholders, current
description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in current receivables (due within one year or one operating cycle) to be collected from the reporting entity's executives and owners.

tlabel: fdic indemnification asset, accretion of discount
description: Increases to the indemnification asset due to accretion of the loan discount relating to loss sharing agreements with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC).
The fair value of loans assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

tlabel: restructuring reserve, foreign currency translation gain (loss)
description: Amount of foreign currency translation gain (loss) which decreases (increases) the restructuring reserve.

tlabel: origination of loans to employee stock ownership plans
description: The cash outflow to finance the entity's defined contribution plan to acquire shares of the entity. The plan initially holds the shares in a suspense account, which is collateral for the loan. As the plan makes payment on the debt, the shares are released from the suspense account and become available to be allocated to participant accounts.

tlabel: unrealized gain (loss) on hybrid instrument, net
description: Amount of the unrealized gain (loss) in earnings for the period from the increase (decrease) in fair value on hybrid instruments measured at fair value.

tlabel: partners' capital account, public sale of units
description: Monetary value of the issuance of new units of limited partnership interest in a public offering.
The gain (loss) is the pre-tax difference between the net condemnation award and the entity's adjusted basis of the condemned property.

tlabel: disposal group, including discontinued operation, cash
description: Amount of currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits, held by a disposal group.
Amount of debt premium to be amortized after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
The fair value of line of credit assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), derivative, excluded component, increase (decrease), after adjustments, tax, noncontrolling interest
description: Amount, after tax and adjustments, of gain (loss) from increase (decrease) in value of excluded component of derivative designated and qualifying as hedge, attributable to noncontrolling interest. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, reclassification for sale and settlement, and amount recognized under systematic and rational method.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants.
Amount of increase (decrease) of consideration paid in advance for advertising that provides economic benefits in future periods.
Amount of interest income from short-term investment classified as other.

tlabel: redeemable noncontrolling interest, equity, preferred, fair value
description: The fair value as of the reporting date of noncontrolling interests which are redeemable by the (parent) entity (1) at a fixed or determinable price on a fixed or determinable date, (2) at the option of the holder of the noncontrolling interest, or (3) upon occurrence of an event that is not solely within the control of the (parent) entity. The noncontrolling interest holder's ownership (or holders' ownership) may be in the form of preferred shares (regardless of class), preferred partnership units (regardless of class), preferential membership interests, or any other form of preferred equity regardless of investee entity legal form.

tlabel: business combination, acquisition of less than 100 percent, noncontrolling interest, fair value
description: This element represents the fair value of the noncontrolling interest in the acquiree at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, contingent liability
description: The amount of liability arising from an inherited contingency (as defined) which has been recognized as of the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, deferred tax liabilities
description: Amount of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable temporary differences assumed at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed, intangible assets, other than goodwill
description: Amount of intangible assets, excluding goodwill, acquired at the acquisition date.

tlabel: business combination, recognized identifiable assets acquired, goodwill,, liabilities assumed, net
description: Amount recognized for assets, including goodwill, in excess of (less than) the aggregate liabilities assumed.

tlabel: investment in physical commodities, fair value disclosure
description: Fair value of investment held in physical commodities, for example, but not limited to, gold, silver, platinum, crude oil, coal, sugar, rice, wheat.

tlabel: allowance for loan, lease loss, recovery of bad debts
description: Amount of recovery of loans and lease receivables which had previously been fully or partially written-off as bad debts.
Amount of direct costs of the business combination including legal, accounting, and other costs incurred to consummate the business acquisition.
Cash deposited in a special reserve account for the exclusive benefit of customers pursuant to regulations other than SEC Regulations and the Commodity Exchange Act.

tlabel: employee stock ownership plan (esop), deferred shares
description: Represents the carrying amount of shares held by the ESOP as of the balance sheet date in which no ESOP participant has a vested interest and no lender has a claim.

tlabel: gain (loss) on sale of previously unissued stock by subsidiary
description: The profit or loss on sales of previously unissued stock by subsidiaries made to investors outside the consolidated group that is not reported as operating income. Represents the difference in the parent company's carrying amount of the equity interest in the subsidiary or equity investee immediately before and after the transaction.

tlabel: adjustment to additional paid-in capital, convertible debt instrument issued at substantial premium
description: Amount of increase (decrease) in additional paid-in capital (APIC) from recognition of substantial premium at which convertible debt instrument is issued.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of the asset arising from a financial instrument or a contract used to hedge price changes in underlying assets, and which are expected to be converted into cash or otherwise disposed of after a year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

tlabel: discontinued operation, amount of continuing cash flows after disposal
description: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from (to) the discontinued operation after the disposal transaction.

tlabel: debt security, available-for-sale, transferred from held-to-maturity, allowance for credit loss, accumulated expense
description: Amount of accumulated expense in retained earnings for allowance for credit loss on investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale) from transfer of investment in debt security measured at amortized cost (held-to-maturity).

tlabel: gain (loss) on discontinuation of interest rate cash flow hedge due to forecasted transaction probable of not occurring, net
description: The amount of net gain (loss) reclassified into earnings when interest rate cash flow hedge is discontinued because it is probable that the original forecasted transactions will not occur by the end of the original period or an additional two month time period.
Amount of increase (decrease) in fee payable for management of fund or trust.

tlabel: payment for purchase, investment, operating activity
description: Amount of cash outflow for acquisition of investment, classified as operating activity. Includes, but is not limited to, funding, origination, drawdown, and participation in investment.

tlabel: proceeds from disposition of investment, operating activity
description: Amount of cash inflow from sale of investment, classified as operating activity. Includes, but is not limited to, repayment, principal payment, paydown, and maturity of investment.
Amount of payable for negative price movement on derivative.
Amount of receivable from positive price movement on derivative.
Cash inflow resulting from recoveries, by any means, against the cost of disposing of plant, whether by demolishing, dismantling, abandoning, sale, and so forth during the period.

tlabel: variable interest entity, initial consolidation, gain (loss)
description: The gain (loss) recognized on initial consolidation of a variable interest entity (VIE) when the VIE is not a business (as defined).

tlabel: noncash or part noncash acquisition, employee benefit liabilities assumed
description: The amount of employee benefit liabilities that an Entity assumes in acquiring a business or in consideration for an asset received in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

Amount of gain (loss) on venture capital activities. Includes venture capital revenue, fair value adjustments, interest and dividends, investment gain (loss) and fee or other income from venture capital activities.

tlabel: noncash or part noncash acquisition, accounts receivable acquired
description: The amount of accounts receivable that an Entity acquires in a noncash (or part noncash) acquisition. Noncash is defined as information about all investing and financing activities of an enterprise during a period that affect recognized assets or liabilities but that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.
Fair value portion of an agreement for an unconditional promise by the maker to pay the holder a definite sum of money at a future date.
The net cash inflow or outflow associated with the aggregate amount of adjustment to the purchase price of a previous acquisition.
Amount of loss recognized at commencement from direct financing lease.

tlabel: liabilities of business transferred under contractual arrangement, current
description: The current carrying amount, due within one year or one operating cycle, if longer, of liabilities resulting from the transfer of a business segment under contractual arrangement where the transferor maintains certain risks, obligations or liabilities.

tlabel: discontinued operation, tax effect of adjustment to prior period gain (loss) on disposal
description: Amount of tax expense (benefit) for an increase (decrease) to a gain (loss) previously reported in discontinued operations in a prior period.

tlabel: increase (decrease) in option premium contracts payable
description: The increase (decrease) during the period in the carrying amount of option premium contracts for energy-related commodities.
The fair value of transfer of mortgage payable in noncash investing or financing activities.

tlabel: related party tax expense, due to affiliates, deferred
description: The amount of any deferred tax-related balances due to affiliates as of the date of each statement of financial position presented.
Amount of the required periodic payments applied to interest.

tlabel: entertainment, license agreement for program material, not in film group, impairment
description: Amount of impairment loss on capitalized cost for right acquired by broadcaster under license agreement for program material not included in film group.

Amount before allocation of valuation allowances of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible temporary differences from in-process research and development costs expensed in connection with a business combination.

This element represents the current portion of a long-term real estate loan to finance building costs. The funds are disbursed as needed or in accordance with a prearranged plan; generally, a portion of the funds is disbursed at inception and the remainder as construction progresses. The money is repaid on completion of the project (generally one to seven years), usually from the proceeds of a mortgage loan. The rate is normally higher than the prime rate, and there is usually an origination fee. The effective yield on these loans tends to be high, and the lender has a security interest in the real property.

Amount of current state and local tax expense (benefit) attributable to income (loss) from continuing operations. Includes, but is not limited to, current regional, territorial, and provincial tax expense (benefit) for non-US (United States of America) jurisdiction.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of building structures held as inventory including any additions, improvements, or renovations to those structures.

Amount, after adjustment, of cost-method investment. Adjustments include, but are not limited to, dividends received in excess of earnings after date of investment that are considered a return of investment and other than temporary impairments.

Amount at end of the reporting period of the aggregate extended product warranty liability that is expected to be paid after one year from the balance sheet date or normal operating cycle, if longer. Does not include the balance for the standard product warranty liability.

Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying value as of the balance sheet date of a written promise to pay a note, initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer, which can be exchanged for a specified amount of one or more securities (typically common stock), at the option of the issuer or the holder.

tlabel: line of credit facility, increase (decrease), net
description: Amount of increase (decrease) of the credit facility.
Amount of realized gain (loss) on investment in marketable security, including other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI).

tlabel: payments for fhlbank advance, investing activities
description: Amount of cash outflow for disbursement to borrower related to advance, made by Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank), classified as investing activity.

Amount at end of the reporting period of the aggregate extended product warranty liability that is expected to be paid after one year from the balance sheet date or normal operating cycle, if longer. Does not include the balance for the standard product warranty liability.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of building structures held as inventory including any additions, improvements, or renovations to those structures.

tlabel: debt securities, available-for-sale, allowance for credit loss, writeoff
description: Amount of writeoff of allowance for credit loss on investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).

tlabel: debt securities, available-for-sale, excluding accrued interest, allowance for credit loss, writeoff
description: Amount, excluding accrued interest, of decrease in allowance for credit loss on investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale) from writeoff.

tlabel: liability for asbestos, environmental claims, net, incurred loss
description: Amount, after effects of reinsurance, of expense for claims incurred and costs incurred in the claim settlement process attributable to asbestos and environmental claims.

tlabel: deferred compensation arrangement with individual, fair value of shares issued
description: The total fair value of shares issued during the period under a deferred compensation arrangement.
Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for contractual rent under lease arrangements.

The excess of (1) the carrying amount of the preferred stock in the registrant's balance sheet over (2) the fair value of the consideration transferred to the holders of the preferred stock, during the accounting period, which will be added to net earnings to arrive at net earnings available to common shareholders in the calculation of earnings per share.
Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and payable for contractual rent under lease arrangements.

The excess of (1) the carrying amount of the preferred stock in the registrant's balance sheet over (2) the fair value of the consideration transferred to the holders of the preferred stock, during the accounting period, which will be added to net earnings to arrive at net earnings available to common shareholders in the calculation of earnings per share.

tlabel: unusual or infrequent item, or both, net of insurance proceeds
description: Amount, after deduction of insurance proceeds, of loss recognized in the income statement for an event or transaction that is unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence, or both.

tlabel: unusual or infrequent item, or both, net of insurance proceeds
description: Amount, after deduction of insurance proceeds, of loss recognized in the income statement for an event or transaction that is unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence, or both.

tlabel: unusual or infrequent item, or both, gain, gross
description: Amount of gain recognized in the income statement for an event or transaction that is unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence, or both.

tlabel: business combination, price of acquisition, expected
description: Purchase price of expected business acquisition prior to consideration being transferred. Excludes asset acquisition.

tlabel: proceeds from sale, collection of other receivables
description: Amount of cash inflow from the sale and collection of receivables classified as other.

tlabel: oci, liability for future policy benefit, gain (loss), before reclassification adjustment, after tax
description: Amount, after tax and before reclassification adjustment, of unrealized gain (loss) from (increase) decrease in liability for future policy benefit from change in discount rate.

tlabel: payments to acquire equipment on lease
description: The cash outflow for payments to acquire rented equipment which is recorded as an asset.

tlabel: temporary equity, accretion to redemption value
description: Value of accretion of temporary equity to its redemption value during the period.

tlabel: share-based compensation arrangement by share-based payment award, options, exercises in period, intrinsic value
description: Amount of accumulated difference between fair value of underlying shares on dates of exercise and exercise price on options exercised (or share units converted) into shares.

tlabel: certain loans acquired in transfer accounted for as debt securities, other-than-temporary impairment charges, credit loss
description: Amount of expense to write-down the amortized cost basis of loans, after acquisition, to fair value when the decline in the fair value is determined to be other than temporary (OTTI) for loans accounted for as debt securities.

tlabel: litigation settlement, amount awarded from other party
description: Amount awarded from other party in judgment or settlement of litigation.

tlabel: other comprehensive income (loss), available-for-sale securities, tax, portion attributable to noncontrolling interest
description: Amount of tax expense (benefit), after reclassification adjustments, of appreciation (loss) in value of unsold available-for-sale securities, attributable to noncontrolling interest. Excludes amounts related to other than temporary impairment (OTTI) loss.

For the asset that is reclassified back to held and use from held-for-sale, the depreciation expense recognized when the asset is reclassified. This represents the difference between the carrying value at the time the decision to reclassify is made and the carrying amount that the asset would have had if it had never been classified as held for sale (including consideration of depreciation expense).
